abstract_summ: A retrospective study was conducted among patients admitted to the William Harvey Hospital in England between March 10th and May10th, 2020 with a laboratory-confirmed severe acute respiratory syndrome-coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2) known as COVID-19 . Patients with diabetes were more likely to have a longer length of stay (LOS) in hospital, 14.4 (SD ±9.6) days, compared to patients without diabetes, p < 0.0001) Patients with diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) were more . likely to survive (87.1%) compared to . patients without DKA (50.6%)
